title: Antonio Cedrés
text:
Antonio Cedrés Cabrera (28 October 1927 – 14 October 2015) was a Spanish professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach.
Playing career.
He played for <a href="Real%20Club%20Victoria">Real Club Victoria</a>, <a href="UD%20Telde">Telde</a>, <a href="UD%20Las%20Palmas">Las Palmas</a> and <a href="Real%20Betis">Real Betis</a>, before retiring at the age of 24 due to injury.
Coaching career.
He later managed <a href="UD%20El%20Carmen">El Carmen</a>, <a href="UD%20Isleta">Isleta</a> and <a href="CD%20Rosiana">Rosiana</a>.
Personal life.
His brothers <a href="Juan%20Cedr%C3%A9s">Juan</a>, <a href="Domingo%20Cedr%C3%A9s">Domingo</a> and <a href="Feluco%20Cedr%C3%A9s">Feluco</a> were also footballers.
